Give a brief explanation of the differences between entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. Entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs are both individuals who possess an innovative mindset, creativity, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. However, the main difference between the two lies in the context and environment in which they operate. An entrepreneur is someone who creates, builds, and manages their own business venture, taking the full risk, responsibility, and ownership of the company. They identify a need in the market and develop a business to meet that need, with the goal of making a profit. In contrast, an intrapreneur is an employee within an existing organization who applies entrepreneurial thinking to their role. They may develop new products, services, or initiatives within the company, often in response to changing market conditions. They are given the autonomy to innovate and drive change within the organization, without bearing the full financial risk or ownership. In summary, entrepreneurs start and own their own businesses while intrapreneurs work within an existing company, using their creativity and innovation to drive the business forward.

Give an example of a convergent boundary. A convergent boundary is a type of tectonic plate boundary that occurs when two neighboring tectonic plates move towards each other, resulting in the collision of the two plates. One example of this type of boundary is the boundary between the Indian Plate and the Eurasian Plate. The Indian Plate is moving northward, and as it collides with the Eurasian Plate, it is being forced under the Eurasian Plate in a process known as subduction. As a result of this collision, the Himalayan mountain range, which includes the world's highest peak, Mount Everest, was formed.

Give three tips for students who are studying for an exam. 1. Create a study schedule: Set aside specific times each day to focus on your studies to avoid cramming all your material the night before the exam. This will allow you to spread out your studying over a longer period, ensuring you cover all the material in a manageable pace. 2. Use different study techniques: Try out different study methods like summarizing notes, creating flashcards, or teaching the material to someone else. This will help you retain information better than just reading over your notes. Find out what works best for you and stick to it. 3. Take breaks and get enough rest: Studying for long periods without a break can lead to burnout and reduced retention of information. Take short breaks after 45-50 minutes of studying to rest your mind, and make sure to get enough sleep the night before the exam. A well-rested brain is better equipped to recall information and perform well on an exam.

Give a list of the disadvantages of nuclear power. 1. Radioactive Waste: Nuclear power generates radioactive waste, which can remain hazardous for thousands of years and requires secure storage. 2. The potential for accidents: Nuclear power plants are complex, and technical failures, natural disasters or human error can potentially release dangerous levels of radiation into the environment. 3. High start-up and decommissioning costs: It is extremely expensive to build and maintain a nuclear power plant and to safely dismantle and decommission the facility at the end of its life cycle. 4. Limited Fuel Supply: Nuclear fuel (uranium) is limited in supply and its availability is dependent on mining or trade. Thus, there might be some geopolitical risks associated with the fuel supply. 5. Proliferation Risk: Nuclear technology and materials could potentially be used to develop nuclear weapons, posing a risk of proliferation of such weapons. 6. Public opposition: Many people are opposed to nuclear power due to concerns about safety and the impact on the environment, making it difficult to gain support for new nuclear power plants. 7. Long construction time: Building a nuclear power plant takes a long time, often over a decade, due to the multiple steps that are necessary to ensure that the plant is built safely and meets regulations.

Choose the right niche: Your channel should have a clear and specific focus that aligns with your brand or personal interests. Stick to the niche and create content related to it to establish a loyal audience. 2. Consistency is key: Regularly posting high-quality videos, at least once a week or more, can help keep your audience engaged and build a consistent subscriber base. 3. Optimize your videos: Use relevant keywords in your titles, descriptions, and tags to help your videos rank higher in search results. Also, choose eye-catching thumbnails to attract viewers. 4. Collaborate with others: Collaborate with other creators, influencers or brands in your niche to broaden your reach and expose your videos to new audiences. 6. Monitor your analytics: Keep track of your analytics, such as views, watch time and audience retention. Give me a list of reasons why people overeat. There are many reasons why people may overeat, including: 1. Emotional eating: Some people use food as a coping mechanism to deal with emotions such as stress, sadness, or boredom. 2. Biological factors: Certain hormones and neurotransmitters can cause increased appetite and cravings. 3. Social and environmental cues: People may overeat in social situations or in response to environmental cues such as the availability of highly palatable food. 4. Lack of sleep: Not getting enough sleep can interrupt hormonal balance, leading to increased hunger and appetite. 5. Mindless eating: Consuming food while distracted, such as while watching TV, can lead to overeating. 6. Dieting and restriction: Following a restrictive diet can often lead to overeating or binge eating when the dieter feels like they’ve “fallen off the wagon.” 7. Medication side effects: Some medications can increase appetite and lead to weight gain. 8. Genetics: Some research suggests that genetics may play a role in appetite regulation and susceptibility to weight gain. 9. Health conditions: Certain health conditions, such as hypothyroidism or polycystic ovary syndrome, can affect appetite and metabolism. 10. Disordered eating: Eating disorders such as bulimia or binge eating disorder can result in periods of excessive food intake.

Give advice to someone going through a difficult time. Going through a difficult time is never easy, but know that you are not alone. Whether you are dealing with personal struggles or facing external challenges, there are things you can do to help make the journey a little easier. 1. Reach out for support: It's always essential to have people you can turn to for support in your life. It might be a close friend, a family member or even a therapist but talking about your difficulties with someone you trust can help you release negative emotions and provide you with an invaluable sense of perspective. 2. Take care of yourself: It can be easy to neglect yourself when you are dealing with difficult situations, but it is important to eat well, exercise regularly and get enough rest. Taking care of yourself physically can help improve your mood and provide the mental and emotional strength you need to navigate your challenges. 3. Accept your feelings: Emotions can be intense during difficult times, and it's important to acknowledge and accept that. You may feel overwhelmed, angry, or sad, and that is completely normal. Instead of pushing your feelings away, let them surface and allow yourself time to process them. 4. Practice mindfulness: Mindfulness involves being present in the moment, acknowledging your thoughts and feelings, and letting them pass without judgment. Practicing mindfulness can help you stay grounded and prevent you from being carried away by emotions and anxiety. 5. Take action: If possible, identify what you can do to address the situation that's causing you difficulty. Taking small, positive steps towards resolving your problems can help you feel more in control and reduce feelings of overwhelm. Remember, it's okay to ask for help, and it's okay to take time for yourself. This difficult time will pass, and you will emerge stronger and more resilient. Trust in yourself and know that you have the strength and courage to overcome this challenge.

Give an example of a context-free grammar. A context-free grammar is a set of production rules for generating strings in a formal language. Here is an example of a simple context-free grammar that defines the set of strings of well-formed parentheses: S → SS S → (S) S → () In this context-free grammar, the start symbol is S, and there are three production rules. The first rule indicates that S can be replaced by SS. This represents the fact that two well-formed strings can be concatenated to generate a larger well-formed string. The second rule states that S can be replaced by (S). This represents the fact that a well-formed string can be surrounded by a pair of parentheses to generate another well-formed string. The final rule states that S can be replaced by (). This represents the fact that an empty pair of parentheses is a well-formed string. Using this context-free grammar, we can generate well-formed strings of parentheses. For instance,here is an example derivation of the string ((())): S → (S) //apply second rule → ((S)) // apply second rule again, replacing S by (S) → (()S) // we can decide to apply first rule which will lead to the below steps → (()()) Or alternatively we can stick to the second replacement → ((S)) //apply second rule → ((())) //apply third rule on S which yields () This grammar can be used to parse any input string and determine whether it is a well-formed string of parentheses or not.

Give some advice for speaking in public. Speaking in public can seem daunting at times but with the right tips and strategies, you can overcome this fear and deliver a great speech. Here are some tips to consider when speaking in public:- 1. Prepare and Practice: Organize your thoughts, prepare your speech and practice until you're comfortable with it. Rehearsing your speech can improve your confidence and reduce nervousness. 2. Engage with the audience: Use eye contact, smile and use hand gestures to interact with your audience. Make your speech relevant and personal to your audience to keep them engaged. 3. Speak clearly and confidently: Speak with a steady pace, and articulate your words properly. Use pauses effectively and take deep breaths in-between. A calm and confident delivery will keep your audience's attention. 4. Use visual aids: When appropriate, use visual aids such as slides, images or props to support your speech. This can help illustrate your points more effectively. 5. Stay calm and positive: Nervousness is common, but try to stay calm and think positively. Take deep breaths and remember that making mistakes is okay. Just take a moment to collect yourself, then continue. With these tips in mind and practice, you'll be able to deliver a great speech and feel more confident when speaking in public.

Give an example of a machine learning algorithm and explain how it works. One example of a machine learning algorithm is a decision tree. A decision tree is a flowchart-like structure where each internal node represents a test or decision on one of the input features, with branches for each possible outcome, and each leaf node representing a predicted class or outcome. The algorithm works by recursively splitting the data into smaller subsets based on their similarity with respect to one or more of the input features. At each split, the feature that results in the greatest information gain, or reduction in entropy, is chosen as the decision criteria. This process continues until all the data within a given subset belong to the same class, or some other stopping criteria is met. Once the decision tree is constructed, it can be used to make predictions on new data by following the branches based on the values of the input features until a leaf node is reached, at which point the predicted class or outcome is returned. The tree can be pruned or refined in various ways to improve its performance by reducing overfitting or minimizing its complexity.

Give the advantages of using a virtual machine (VM) A virtual machine (VM) is a virtual computer that runs within a physical computer. It acts as an emulator of a computer system by providing a virtualized environment where users can run multiple operating systems and applications simultaneously without affecting the host system. There are several advantages to using virtual machines, including: 1. Isolation: VMs enable multiple operating systems and applications to be run on the same computer, while keeping each operating system and application isolated from one another. This minimizes the risk of conflicts, improves security and prevents crashes and malware from affecting the host system. 2. Flexibility: VMs allow users the flexibility to quickly deploy and test applications, operating systems and configurations on the same hardware without the need to purchase additional physical systems. This results in cost savings and faster deployments. 3. Portability: VMs can be easily moved from one physical computer to another or even to another cloud provider. This enables users to quickly and easily transfer or replicate their systems, which increases scalability and simplifies disaster recovery. 4. Increased productivity: By enabling developers and testers to work on the same system without impacting one another, VMs can increase productivity and facilitate collaboration. 5. Reduced IT costs: Virtual machines can help reduce costs associated with hardware, power consumption, storage and maintenance, while also enabling businesses to maximize the utilization of their hardware resources. Overall, virtual machines provide a flexible, cost-effective and convenient way to run multiple operating systems and applications on the same hardware, which can help businesses to increase productivity and efficiency, while reducing IT costs.

Give a possible explanation for recent declines in pollinator populations. Recent declines in pollinator populations have been attributed to several interconnected factors. One major factor is habitat destruction and fragmentation, such as deforestations and the conversion of wild landscapes to agriculture, urban, and commercial areas. This has resulted in the loss of floral sources, shelter, and nesting sites, which are crucial components of pollinator habitats. Another factor is the widespread use of pesticides, especially neonicotinoid insecticides, which are highly toxic to pollinators. When sprayed on blooming plants, these insecticides can contaminate pollen and nectar, which are then consumed by pollinators. Exposure to these chemicals can result in direct kills or sub-lethal effects, such as impairments of learning, memory, and foraging behaviors in bees. Pollinators are also affected by the spread of parasites and diseases, including mites, bacteria, and viruses. Some of these pathogens are spread by commercial beekeepers, who transport their hives across the country for pollination services, potentially introducing diseases to local bee populations. Climate change is also an important factor, as changes in temperature and precipitation patterns can shift flowering times and disrupt pollination. Overall, the decline of the pollinator population is a complex issue that results from a combination of environmental stressors. To protect these vital species, efforts are needed to preserve and restore habitats, reduce the use of harmful pesticides and promote sustainable farming practices, control the spread of diseases and parasites, and mitigate the impacts of climate change.

Give me information about the Three Gorges Dam. The Three Gorges Dam is a hydroelectric dam that spans the Yangtze River in central China. It is the world's largest power station in terms of installed capacity (22,500 MW). The dam was built with the aims of generating electricity, increasing the river's shipping capacity, and reducing the potential for floods downstream. Construction began in 1994 and was officially completed in 2012. The project faced controversy both domestically and abroad due to its environmental and social impact, including the relocation of over 1 million people from the dam's flooded areas. The dam is made of concrete and steel and is 2,335 meters (7,660 ft) long and 185 meters (607 ft) high. It includes 32 main generators, each capable of producing 700MW of electricity. The dam also includes a ship lift, allowing vessels to pass through the dam. The Three Gorges Dam has had a significant impact on the Yangtze River and the surrounding areas. It has helped mitigate the incidence of floods, allowing for agricultural and urban development in the floodplain. However, concerns have been raised about the dam's effect on wildlife, particularly fish species, and on water quality.

Give 3 examples of importance sampling. 1. Monte Carlo simulations: In situations where it is difficult to compute the expectation of a random variable analytically, Monte Carlo simulations can be used to estimate it through random sampling. However, when dealing with rare events or highly skewed distributions, it can be very inefficient to use standard random sampling, as it would take a lot of samples to obtain a good estimate. Importance sampling can be used in these cases to choose a sampling distribution that assigns more probability to the important regions, which can significantly reduce the number of samples required to obtain a good estimate. 2. Variance Reduction in Computer Graphics: In computer graphics, Monte Carlo integration is used to estimate the light transport equation to create realistic images. However, the high variance of some Monte Carlo estimators can result in noisy images, especially in scenes with complex lighting interactions. Importance sampling can be used in this context to reduce the variance of the estimator by sampling the light sources according to their contribution to the final image, which can result in smoother images with less noise. 3. Bayesian Inference: Importance sampling can be used in Bayesian inference to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters when the likelihood function is difficult to evaluate. This is common in models with complex or high-dimensional likelihood functions, where computing the normalization constant of the posterior distribution can be challenging. By using importance sampling, it is possible to select a proposal distribution that approximates the shape of the posterior, which allows for efficient sampling of the important regions of the parameter space.

Give me an example of a stochastic gradient descent algorithm. Stochastic gradient descent (SGD) is an optimization algorithm used for finding the minimum value of a cost function by iteratively updating the parameters of the model. Here is an example of using SGD for linear regression: Suppose we have a dataset of n observations and a linear model `y = b0 + b1*x` where b0 and b1 are the coefficients that we want to estimate. 1. Initialize the coefficients b0 and b1 with random values. 2. Choose a learning rate, alpha, that determines the step size for each update. 3. For each epoch (full pass through the data): a. Shuffle the data. b. For i in range(n): i. Select one data point (xi, yi) from the training set. ii. Make a prediction using the current values of b0 and b1: `y_pred = b0 + b1*xi` iii. Calculate the error: `error = y_pred - yi` iv. Update the coefficients: - `b0 = b0 - alpha * error` - `b1 = b1 - alpha * error * xi` 4. Repeat step 3 for a fixed number of epochs or until the error converges. In this example, the coefficients are updated for each data point, which makes the optimization process noisy but helps to avoid getting stuck in local minima. The learning rate controls the size of the steps taken towards the minimum. A small learning rate might result in slower convergence, while a large learning rate could cause the algorithm to diverge.

Give five tips that would help someone to become a better listener 1. **Be present and attentive**: When you're having a conversation with someone, make sure you're focused on them and not distracted by other things around you. It's important to look at the other person, listen to their words and tone, and be totally present in the moment. 2. **Avoid interrupting**: Interrupting can be a sign of impatience, disrespect, or simply not paying attention to them. Allow the person speaking to fully express their thoughts before responding, even if you have something pressing to say. 3. **Repeat and summarize**: When the other person has finished speaking, it can be helpful to repeat or summarize their key points to show that you have listened and understood. This also gives the opportunity for the speaker to clarify any misunderstanding. 4. **Ask questions**: Asking relevant questions can show that you have listened and that you are interested in knowing more. This encourages a deeper, more meaningful conversation and can also improve your understanding of the topic. 5. **Body language**: Non-verbal communication plays an important part in showing that you are listening. Make sure your body language is receptive and attentive, such as leaning in slightly, nodding, and maintaining eye contact. Conveying that you are actively engaged is important for a good listener.

Loosen the soil to about 12 inches deep and mix in some compost, manure or a balanced fertilizer. 2. **Dig holes**: Tulips grow best when planted 4-6 inches apart and about 6-8 inches deep. Make sure that the bottom of the bulb is in good contact with the soil. 4. **Cover with soil**: Cover the bulbs with soil and press it down gently so that there are no air pockets. Water the soil well so that the bulbs can start rooting. 5. **Mulch the bed**: Once the soil has dried, cover the bed with a layer of mulch. This will help to retain moisture and protect the bulbs from extreme temperatures. In the spring, you'll see the first shoots of your tulips emerging from the ground.

Give a few examples of bias in machine learning models. Bias in machine learning models refers to errors introduced into the model due to the assumptions made during its development. Some examples of bias in machine learning models include: 1. Selection Bias: This refers to bias in the selection of data used to train the model, which may not be representative of the entire population. 2. Sampling Bias: This occurs when the data used to train the model is not randomly selected and therefore does not represent the entire population. 3. Prejudice Bias: This type of bias occurs when the model is influenced by societal or cultural prejudices, leading to discriminatory outcomes. This can occur when the data used to train the model contains underlying prejudices or when the model is developed by a team lacking diversity. 4. Measurement Bias: This occurs when there are errors in the data used to train the model, such as incorrect measurements or data entry errors. 5. Algorithmic Bias: This refers to bias introduced into the model by the algorithm used to develop it. For example, certain algorithms may have a tendency to prioritize certain types of data, leading to biased outcomes. Overall, it is important to be aware of these different types of bias when developing machine learning models, and to take steps to mitigate them in order to ensure that the model produces fair and accurate results.

Eat a wide variety of nutrient-rich foods: Try to include foods from all the food groups in your daily diet, including fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. This will provide your body with all the essential nutrients it needs to function properly. 2. Be mindful of portion sizes: Eating too much of even healthy food can lead to weight gain. Limit processed and junk food: Processed foods, fast foods, and junk foods are often high in calories, unhealthy fats, and sugars. Try to limit these foods and opt for healthier snacks and home-cooked meals made with fresh, whole ingredients. 4. Stay hydrated: Water is essential for good health and helps to regulate body temperature, flushes out toxins, and transport nutrients throughout the body. Make sure you stay hydrated by drinking water, and avoiding sugary drinks and sodas. 5. Practice mindful eating: Pay attention to how you feel while you eat, and stop eating when you feel full. Try to eat slowly, savoring each bite, and avoid distractions like TV or your phone while eating. This helps with digestion, and helps prevent overeating.

Give an example of a rapid evolutionary adaptation One example of a rapid evolutionary adaptation can be found in the peppered moth (Biston betularia) in England during the early 19th century. Prior to the Industrial Revolution, the peppered moth predominantly had a light coloration that helped them camouflage against light-colored trees and lichens. However, as the Industrial Revolution progressed, soot and pollution from factories darkened the tree trunks and killed off the lichens, making the light-colored moths more visible to predators. In response to this change in environment, peppered moths with a darker coloration, caused by a mutation in their DNA, had a better chance of survival as they were better camouflaged against the darkened trees. As a result, the frequency of the dark-colored variant rapidly increased in the population in just a few decades. This is an example of natural selection driving a rapid evolutionary adaptation in response to changes in the environment.

Give some tips for managing stress Stress is a common issue that affects everyone from time to time. Here are some tips on how to manage stress: 1. Practice mindfulness: Mindfulness involves staying present and fully engaged in the current moment. Focusing on your breathing or engaging in mindful activities such as meditation or yoga can help reduce stress. 2. Exercise: Physical activity is a great way to reduce stress as it releases endorphins (feel-good hormones), improves mood, and helps you to sleep better. 3. Manage your time: Being organized can help you to feel more in control and less overwhelmed. Make a list of tasks, prioritize them, and break them into manageable chunks. 4. Take breaks: Taking short breaks throughout the day can help to recharge your batteries and reduce stress levels. Make sure to step away from your work, take a walk, or do something that you enjoy. 5. Connect with others: Talking to someone about how you're feeling can help to alleviate stress. Connect with friends, family, or a counselor for support. 6. Eat well: Eating a well-balanced and nutritious diet can help to boost your mood and energy levels, so you're better equipped to handle stress. 7. Get enough sleep: Lack of sleep can contribute to stress, so it's important to get enough quality sleep each night. Establish a good bedtime routine, avoid screens before bed, and create a comfortable sleep environment. 8. Practice self-care: Take time for yourself and engage in activities that make you happy and relaxed. This could be reading, taking a bath, or listening to music. Remember, everyone experiences stress differently and what works for one person may not work for another. Experiment with different coping strategies to find what works best for you.

Give a description of a day living on Mars. Living on Mars is an extraordinary experience. The day, or sol as it is called on Mars, is slightly longer than a day on Earth, lasting 24 hours and 39 minutes. Waking up in a habitat on Mars would feel otherworldly. The first thing you'd notice is the light: the Sun is farther away, so its light appears about half as bright. The sky has an orange-reddish hue due to the dust and atmospheric conditions. After getting ready and having breakfast, it would be time to start the day's activities. If you are part of a scientific mission, you may go outside to collect samples, maintain equipment or explore the rugged terrain. Due to the thin atmosphere and lack of a magnetosphere, you would need to wear a protective suit to venture out on the Martian surface. Communication with Earth involves a time delay, so most plans and schedules have to be set in advance. If needed, data and progress reports are sent back to mission control. The rest of the day might be spent analyzing data, conducting experiments, or working on maintenance tasks. After the workday is over, leisure time on Mars could be spent exercising, reading, or watching entertainment sent from Earth. Without the distractions of modern urban life, you might find yourself taking time to contemplate the unique experience of being one of the first humans to live on another planet. As the day winds down, you'd have a meal with fellow residents before retiring to bed. Lying in bed, you could look up and see the stars shining with increased intensity due to the thin atmosphere. Going to sleep on Mars would be a surreal experience, knowing that you are part of history, living out humanity’s dream of exploring the cosmos.

Create a to-do list: Write down all the tasks you need to do in a day, and avoid the common mistakes of overloading or underloading the list. Break down complex tasks into manageable subtasks. 3. This could include counseling services, stress management programs, or access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP). Give me three facts about black holes. 1. Black holes are regions in space with an extremely strong gravitational force so powerful that nothing, not even light, can escape its pull once it crosses the event horizon. 2. Black holes are formed from the remnants of a massive star that has collapsed in on itself. When a star burns through the last of its fuel, it may explode into a supernova, after which gravity takes over causing the leftover mass to compress into an incredibly small space. 3. There are three different types of black holes categorized based on their mass, namely: primordial, stellar and supermassive black holes. Primordial black holes are the smallest and have masses ranging from an atom to a mountain. Stellar black holes have masses up to about 20 times as much as the sun. Supermassive black holes, on the other hand, have masses equivalent to billions of suns, and are found at the centers of most galaxies including the Milky Way.

Get Familiar with the Public Transportation System: Understanding the public transportation system in a new city is essential for navigating your way around. Study the transportation maps, learn about the different modes of transportation available, and don’t be afraid to ask for help if you need it. 3. Explore and Network: One of the best ways to get to know a new city is to explore. This can mean taking walks or bike rides, visiting local markets or festivals, or trying different restaurants or cafes. Joining local clubs or organizations is also a great way to meet new people and make friends. Don’t be afraid to put yourself out there and start building a network, because having a support system and making connections is important in any new place.

Give an example of how someone could save money. One way someone could save money is by identifying and reducing unnecessary expenses. This could be done by creating a budget, tracking monthly spending, and then cutting back on nonessential items. For instance, instead of eating out frequently or buying takeaway meals, someone could save money by cooking at home and taking packed lunches to work. Additionally, opting for a cheaper form of entertainment such as streaming movies at home or going for outdoor walks could help to reduce expenses. By making small changes and reducing unnecessary spending, an individual can save money over time.

Give an example of a bias that could exist in an AI algorithm. One example of a bias that could exist in an AI algorithm is gender bias. This can occur when an algorithm is trained on historical data that reflects existing societal gender biases, leading the algorithm to make predictions or decisions based on those biases. For instance, if an AI system used for hiring is trained on data from a company with a history of male-dominated leadership, the algorithm may "learn" to favor male candidates over equally or more qualified female candidates due to the patterns it has detected in the training data. This can perpetuate gender inequality and result in unfair treatment of female candidates.

Harry Potter: The main protagonist of the series, Harry is known as the boy who lived, as he survived an attack by Voldemort as a baby. Hermione Granger: Hermione is a muggle-born witch, meaning she comes from a non-magical family but possess remarkable magical abilities. She is very intelligent, skilled at magic, especially in casting spells, brewing potions, and unravelling charms. 3. Albus Dumbledore: One of the greatest wizards of all time, Dumbledore possesses many extraordinary powers, including the ability to perform very powerful magic, use wandless magic, and even defeat other powerful wizards in duels.
